currentDoc:
Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  

It is not surprising someone whou

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  

It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stra

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  

It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a fami

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger i

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

hat is the Difference Between a Human and an Animal?
  Humans are animals.  We believe we are the apex of the an

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

hat is the Difference Between a Human and an Animal?
  Humans are animals.  We believe we are the apex of the animal world.  We may well be wrong

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

hat is the Difference Between a Human and an Animal?
  Humans are animals.  We believe we are the apex of the animal world.  We may well be wrong.  Whales and other marine life

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

hat is the Difference Between a Human and an Animal?
  Humans are animals.  We believe we are the apex of the animal world.  We may well be wrong.  Whales and other marine life have shown signs of intelligence approaching that of humans. Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

hat is the Difference Between a Human and an Animal?
  Humans are animals.  We believe we are the apex of the animal world.  We may well be wrong.  Whales and other marine life have shown signs of intelligence approaching that of humans.  Primates are very human-like and in some ways superior.  It is not a stretch to believe that we are not the only intelligent life on this planet and we all have a right to a reasonable life.

  Humans are animals.  We believe we are the apex of the animal world.  We may well be wrong.  Whales and other marine life have shown signs of intelligence approaching that of humans.  Primates are very human-like and in some ways superior.  It is not a stretch to believe that we are not the only intelligent life on this planet and we all have a right to a reasonable life.  

It's a thorny dilemma and is much debate

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

hat is the Difference Between a Human and an Animal?
  Humans are animals.  We believe we are the apex of the animal world.  We may well be wrong.  Whales and other marine life have shown signs of intelligence approaching that of humans.  Primates are very human-like and in some ways superior.  It is not a stretch to believe that we are not the only intelligent life on this planet and we all have a right to a reasonable life.

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

hat is the Difference Between a Human and an Animal?
  Humans are animals.  We believe we are the apex of the animal world.  We may well be wrong.  Whales and other marine life have shown signs of intelligence approaching that of humans.  Primates are very human-like and in some ways superior.  It is not a stretch to believe that we are not the only intelligent life on this planet and we all have a right to a reasonable life.  

It's a thorny dilemma and is much debated.  The issues are important and the results w

In my opinion, it is human nature to care more about the welfare of something helpless than something we perceive as being capable.  Human beings will almost always help a child before an adult due to that instinct.  We perceive animals in the same light, helpless and innocent.

Is it right?  That is a question that the 'animal movement' says a resounding 'yes' to.  There is a huge movement to wean us from eating animal products.  There are movements to ban the 'ownership' of pets.  There are movements to grant animals 'rights'.  It is not surprising someone would choose their pet over a stranger because that pet is part of a family unit and a human stranger is not.

hat is the Difference Between a Human and an Animal?
  Humans are animals.  We believe we are the apex of the animal world.  We may well be wrong.  Whales and other marine life have shown signs of intelligence approaching that of humans.  Primates are very human-like and in some ways superior.  It is not a stretch to believe that we are not the only intelligent life on this planet and we all have a right to a reasonable life.  

It's a thorny dilemma and is much debated.  The issues are important and the results will be far-reaching.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.
